messages: 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:47): oh look, more false dichotomies from rubys: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2009May/0161.html
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:48): wonders if rubys ever read the mailing list archives before he was appointed from on high
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:48): waits for 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 to make another appearance on MLW's infamous blog
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:49): the title of the spec was settled a long time ago
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:51): is inexplicably reminded of the classic "bungee boss" dilbert strip
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:52): "Hi-I'm-Your-New-Boss-Let's-Change-Everything-Before-I-Get-Reassigned-Oops-Too-Late-Goodbye"
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:52): He was like a mentor to me
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (16:52): Do you expect he'll be reassigned?
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:53): no one seems to know why or how he was assigned in the first place
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:53): 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19: You should volunteer to be chair
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:54): I can't imagine any ways in which that could fail to work
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:54): lately the working group seems to have been infested with bungee trolls
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:56): Hmm‚Ä¶ according to this textbook, -2\frac{dy}{dx}-1 = \frac{2(x+y)}{x} - 1
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:56): "Hi-I-Care-Deeply-About-The-Future-Of-The-Web-Let's-Change-Everything-Before-I-Get-Exasperated-Oops-Too-Late-Goodbyte"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:56): How is the first term not negative?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:56): (on the RHS)

61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:57): "We specifically need people to put forward suggestions for @profile and @summary.  If no such proposals are produced, such issues will be summarily closed." <-- noted for future reference
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:58): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: How do you go from dx to x?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:58): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I'm not entirely sure about that either
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (16:58): Is that an identity or an equation to solve?
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (16:58): isn't sure rubys understands the biggest sticking point with the spec license
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:58): Identity
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (16:59): Then I'm with ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, it seems to be missing something
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:03): Fortunately nobody seems have cared about the bit in my document that says "This is blatant copyright infringement."
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:04): Or using the W3C stylesheet
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:04): wonders what 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 thinks the biggest sticking point is
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:04): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: That too
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:09): http://secret a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554.com/school/id.jpg
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:09): (This is blatant copyright infringement.)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:10): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: The question makes much more sense when we can see that dy/dx = -(x+y)/x
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:11): Oh, so they substitute for it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:11): That makes sense
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:11): (by rearranging the expression on the first line)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:13): rhetorically wonders if it is worth pointing out to Shelley that she doesn't get to define who "participated" in HTML 5
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (17:14): rhetorically avoids answering
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:15): doesn't know who is supposed to be owning anything
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:15): traditionally, choosing a license is reserved for the copyright owner
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:15): Oh, I follow now
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:15): Doesn't the W3C traditionally own the copyright on the specs it publishes?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:16): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: The W3C host sites do, not W3C
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:16): "Copyright ¬©1997-1999 W3C¬Æ (MIT, INRIA, Keio), All Rights Reserved.", "Copyright ¬© 2009 W3C¬Æ (MIT, ERCIM, Keio), All Rights Reserved.", etc
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:27): http://secret a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554.com/school/dif2.jpg
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:27): is that right?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:31): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Looks about right to me
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:31): though you could have cancelled out the 2s much earlier, to save a lot of writing :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:32): That is true.
